intro: Biscutella didyma f. coriophora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved biscuitroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, narrow leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and ecologists studying plant adaptation to harsh climates.
